gameplayController

Class GameplayController

  • java.lang.Object
    • gameplayController.GameplayController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.util.EventListener

    public class GameplayController
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener
    This class contains the various methods that controls the gameplay aspect of this game, such as taking the required action given certain user inputs, updating positions of all objects on the gamepanel, controlling the game timer, repainting the gamepanel one each iteration of the game timer, etc.
    Author:
    Olivier Laforest

    • Constructor Detail

      • GameplayController

        public GameplayController(MenuController menuCtrl)
        Constructs a gameplay controller with the game context initialized to the beginning of the level that was selected in the menu controller by the user. All other parameters are initialized to their default value, the game frame is made visible, and the game timer is started.
        Parameters:
        menuCtrl - the menu controller of this application

      • GameplayController

        public GameplayController(MenuController menuCtrl,
                  GameContext gameContext)
        Constructs a gameplay controller with the game context initialized to the point where the saved game to be resumed was saved. All parameters are initialized to the value at which they were saved.
        Parameters:
        menuCtrl - the menu controller of this application
        gameContext - the game context of the saved game to be resumed

    • Method Detail

      • actionPerformed

        public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent event)
        Runs each time the game timer delay TIMEOUT reaches 0. On each iteration of the game timer, the status of every object in the game is updated, collision between each possible combinations of objects is checked. If collision occurs, proper action is taken. Lastly, the game view and the game status is updated, and the game panel is repainted.
        Specified by:
        actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener
        Parameters:
        event - the event that triggered the actionPerformed method
        See Also:
        ActionListener.actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent)

      • getGameContext

        public GameContext getGameContext()
        Returns:
        the game context of the currently played game

      • resumeGame

        public void resumeGame()
        Sets the game frame visible and restarts the game timer.
